snippet: As more than two dozen people have died in clashes between Rohingyas and Buddhist villagers, commenters have expressed their grievances online.
abstract: Burmese air their grievances online about the Rohingya, Muslim ethnic group embroiled in sectarian clashes in western Myanmar that have left more than two dozen people dead; postings urge the government to get rid of them and seem particularly enraged that Western countries and the United Nations are highlighting their plight; the source of hatred toward the Rohingya is complex but appears to turn on religion, language, colonial resentment, nationalism and skin color.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: As more than two dozen people have died in clashes between Rohingyas and Buddhist villagers, commenters have expressed their grievances online.

headline.seo: New Freedom Lets Burmese Air Venom Toward Rohingya Muslims
headline.main: Internet Unshackled, Burmese Aim Venom at Ethnic Minority
headline.print_headline: Internet Unshackled, Burmese Aim Venom at Ethnic Minority

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
